header.gameNote: HALL OF FAME SHOWCSE AT SPRINGFIELD MA

article.description: Anthony Gurley led a balanced scoring attack with 14 points and Massachusetts proved too fast for TCU in 67-48 victory Monday night.
article.headline: UMass rides balanced attack to win over TCU
article.linkText: UMass rides balanced attack to win over TCU
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mass. -- Anthony Gurley led a balanced scoring attack with 14 points and Massachusetts proved too fast for TCU in 67-48 victory Monday night in the Basketball Hall of Fame Tipoff tournament. The Minutemen, 4-0 for the first time since 2001-02, employed a pressing defense and an up-tempo offense to control the game. They forced the Horned Frogs into 17 turnovers and put them in a huge hole. TCU led 14-12 midway through the first half when the Minutemen took over with a 19-2 run. Javorn Farrell scored 12, half of them coming during the spurt that gave Massachusetts a 31-16 lead. The Minutemen led 35-21 at halftime, and it only got worse for TCU. A 12-0 run early in the second half put Massachusetts ahead 49-23 and little more than two minutes later Freddie Riley's slam dunk gave the Minutemen a 56-27 advantage, their largest of the game. Ronnie Moss led TCU with 10 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
